intro: Habranthus riojanus, commonly known as the Rioja bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or white. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded locations. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
